feed.title: Chidambaranathan Anirudh
feed.subtitle: Hello. I'm Chidambaranathan Anirudh. I am an Associate Software Engineer in Oracle, India.

entry.title: How to prepare for Campus Placements?

link.title: How to prepare for Campus Placements?

entry.summary: This is written from my experience of appearing for campus placements. The blog post is a general guide and NOT written considering a specific company. The resources and the preparation method I used worked for me, however it might not be the same for you. Read through, consider the positives, and take the approach that works best for you! So lets get right to it! ⚙️ Ge...

entry.title: Oracle Interview Experience
entry.summary: Oracle GBU campus placement drive | Virtual process Round 1 Round 1 was an online MCQ round consisting of aptitude, verbals, reasoning, and technical questions. The round was divided into many sections with a separate time frame for each section. The total time, including all sections, was 107 minutes. Round 2 (Coding Round) Round 2 was an online coding round, in which we were given two cod...

entry.title: Notes - TCP Congestion Control
entry.summary: The following notes have been made with reference to the book Computer Networking A Top Down Approach by Kurose and Ross. Content has been quoted from the book. All credits to the author. TCP provides a reliable transport service between two processes running on different hosts. Another key component of TCP is its congestion-control mechanism. TCP must use end-to-end congestion contro...

entry.title: Notes - The Network Layer
entry.summary: The following notes have been made with reference to the book Computer Networking A Top Down Approach by Kurose and Ross. Content has been quoted from the book. All credits to the author. The transport layer provides various forms of process-to-process communication by relying on the network layer’s host-to-host communication service. entry.title: Notes - Pretty Good Privacy (PGP)
entry.summary: The following notes have been made with reference to the book Cryptography and Network Security: Principles and Practice, 5th Edition by William Stallings. Content has been quoted from the book. All credits to the author. With the increased reliance on email, there grows a demand for authentication and confidentiality services.
